VirtualFile.Name: Config.WTF
VirtualFile.Description: Config.WTF stores your last Battle.net and World of Warcraft account names, last realm and characters played, as well as video, sound and other settings. This Virtual File allows different Config.WTF files per Character.

WindowLayout.Name: All 80s
WindowLayout.Description: This Window Layout features stacked windows with no border, the size of the full screen, on \\.\DISPLAY1. Swapping disabled. Does not leave space for the Windows taskbar. This style is great in conjunction with Video FX to see parts of, or all of, the other windows.

WindowLayout.Name: Pally & DKs
WindowLayout.Description: This Window Layout features a full screen-ish main window on \\.\DISPLAY1 and the rest on \\.\DISPLAY2. Swapping enabled. Does not include a home for every window. All home regions have the same aspect ratio as the main region.

WindowLayout.Name: Shamans & Druids
WindowLayout.Description: This Window Layout features a full screen-ish main window on \\.\DISPLAY1 and the rest on \\.\DISPLAY2. Swapping enabled. Includes a home region for every window. All home regions have the same aspect ratio as the main region.

WindowLayout.Name: Goblins
WindowLayout.Description: This Window Layout features a full screen-ish main window on \\.\DISPLAY4 and the rest on \\.\DISPLAY5. Swapping enabled. Does not include a home for every window. All home regions have the same aspect ratio as the main region. Does not leave space for the Windows taskbar.

WindowLayout.Name: Goblin Gather
WindowLayout.Description: This Window Layout features a single window with no border, the size of the full screen, on each of 2 screens. Swapping enabled.

WindowLayout.Name: GoblinsAll
WindowLayout.Description: This Window Layout features a full screen-ish main window on \\.\DISPLAY1 and the rest on \\.\DISPLAY2. Swapping enabled. Does not include a home for every window. All home regions have the same aspect ratio as the main region. Does not leave space for the Windows taskbar.

RepeaterProfile.Name: Default
RepeaterProfile.Description:
It is not recommended to change the Startup defaults of the generated Repeater Profile, or to set Hotkeys in it. For best results, assign a hotkey through the Control Key Map instead.
When using the Quick Setup, you should rarely need to use Repeater. See the WoW Quick Start Guide at http://isboxer.com/index.php/guides/69-wow-guide-quick-start for information on Repeater and easily setting up all of the broadcasting keys that you need.

KeyMap.Name: General
KeyMap.Description: This Key Map is intended for general and non-combat use, things that can usually be used by all of your Character Sets.

MappedKey.Name: Dance With My Target
MappedKey.Description: This is an example of a key that assists and performs a WoW Macro, such as /dance. Similar macros can be used for achievements, e.g. /love (critters) and /hug (pvp).

MappedKey.Name: FTL Assist Me
MappedKey.Description:
This is the generated "Assist Me" key. It is automatically used by default by keys in the FTL DPS Keys map. You can also use this as a manual assist Hotkey, just change the Hotkey above as needed.
The way this key works is by sending a different set of modifiers (Alt, Ctrl, or Shift) along with a keystroke, so that the game basically performs a different /assist macro depending on which window it is sent from. That is "FTL" in a nutshell.
If you want a subset (e.g. an Action Target Group) of characters to assist you instead of all of the others, make a copy of this Mapped Key and adjust the Target of the action in step 1.

MappedKey.Name: FTL Follow Me
MappedKey.Description:
This is the generated "Follow Me" key. It is automatically used by default by keys in the Control map. You can also use this as a manual follow Hotkey, just change the Hotkey above as needed.
The way this key works is by sending a different set of modifiers (Alt, Ctrl, or Shift) along with a keystroke, so that the game basically performs a different /follow macro depending on which window it is sent from. That is "FTL" in a nutshell.
If you want a subset (e.g. an Action Target Group) of characters to follow you instead of all of the others, make a copy of this Mapped Key and adjust the Target of the action in step 1.

MappedKey.Name: FTL Target Me
MappedKey.Description:
This is the generated "Target Me" key. It does not have a Hotkey by default, nor is it used by other maps by default.
The way this key works is by sending a different set of modifiers (Alt, Ctrl, or Shift) along with a keystroke, so that the game basically performs a different /target macro depending on which window it is sent from. That is "FTL" in a nutshell.
If you want a subset (e.g. an Action Target Group) of characters to target you instead of all of the others, make a copy of this Mapped Key and adjust the Target of the action in step 1.

MappedKey.Name: Interact with Target
MappedKey.Description:
The WoW Quick Start Guide has a section that explains how to set up Interact with Target, which will help you interact with NPCs (e.g. merchants, quest givers and enemies) and, when combined with Click to Move, can be used to keep melees on target.
See http://isboxer.com/wiki/WoW:Quick_Start_Guide#Interaction_with_NPCs.

MappedKey.Name: Invite Others
MappedKey.Description: Invites other Characters in your Character Set to group. If you have linked Character Sets together with Also Launch, you may want to adjust the macro to /invite additional characters.

MappedKey.Name: Others Jump
MappedKey.Description: Makes your other characters jump.

MappedKey.Name: Toggle Jamba Follow Strobing
MappedKey.Description: Turns Jamba Follow Strobing on or off

MappedKey.Name: Flying V Formation
MappedKey.Description:
Generated for movement keys WASD with Q and E for strafe left/right, and up to 5 characters.
The Flying V aligns your characters in a V behind the leader. This example mapping always aligns them behind the character in slot 1.

MappedKey.Name: Line Formation
MappedKey.Description:
Generated for movement keys WASD with Q and E for strafe left/right, and up to 5 characters.
The Line formation aligns your characters in a line to the left and right of the leader. This example mapping always aligns them next to the character in slot 1.

MappedKey.Name: Star Formation
MappedKey.Description:
Generated for movement keys WASD with Q and E for strafe left/right, and up to 5 characters.
The Star formation aligns your characters in all four directions around the leader (forward, backward, left and right). This example mapping always aligns them around the character in slot 1.

MappedKey.Name: Others turn Left
MappedKey.Description:
Generated for movement keys WASD with Q and E for strafe left/right.
This can be used to break auto-follow (WoW does not provide a more convenient method), just set a Hotkey and, if needed, change the key it sends to the other windows in step 1.

MappedKey.Name: Others turn Right
MappedKey.Description:
Generated for movement keys WASD with Q and E for strafe left/right.
This can be used to break auto-follow (WoW does not provide a more convenient method), just set a Hotkey and, if needed, change the key it sends to the other windows in step 1.

MappedKey.Name: Melee IWT
MappedKey.Description:
The WoW Quick Start Guide has a section that explains how to set up Interact with Target, which will help you interact with NPCs (e.g. merchants, quest givers and enemies) and, when combined with Click to Move, can be used to keep melees on target.
See http://isboxer.com/wiki/WoW:Quick_Start_Guide#Interaction_with_NPCs.

MappedKey.Name: Set Camera
MappedKey.Description: This is an example of a key that assists and performs a WoW Macro, such as /dance. Similar macros can be used for achievements, e.g. /love (critters) and /hug (pvp).

MappedKey.Name: Casters Strafe Left
MappedKey.Description:

MappedKey.Description:

Generated for movement keys WASD with Q and E for strafe left/right.
This can be used to break auto-follow (WoW does not provide a more convenient method), just set a Hotkey and, if needed, change the key it sends to the other windows in step 1.

MappedKey.Name: Dismount
MappedKey.Description: This is an example of a key that assists and performs a WoW Macro, such as /dance. Similar macros can be used for achievements, e.g. /love (critters) and /hug (pvp).

WoWMacro.MacroCommands: /jamba-team iammaster all /console farclip 1250 /console groundEffectDensity 48 /console groundEffectDistance 260 /console environmentDetail 40 /console particleDensity 100 /console shadowMode 0 /console waterDetail 0 /console reflectionMode 0 /console sunShafts 0 /console basemip 1 /console terrainMipLevel 1 /console projectedTextures 0 /console weatherDensity 0 /console componentTextureLevel 1 /console textureFilteringMode 1

/console farclip 350 /console groundEffectDensity 0 /console groundEffectDistance 0 /console environmentDetail 0 /console particleDensity 10 /console shadowMode 0 /console waterDetail 0 /console reflectionMode 0 /console sunShafts 0 /console basemip 1 /console terrainMipLevel 1 /console projectedTextures 0 /console weatherDensity 0 /console componentTextureLevel 0 /console textureFilteringMode 0

MappedKey.Name: Star Formation (Reverse)
MappedKey.Description:
Generated for movement keys WASD with Q and E for strafe left/right, and up to 5 characters.
The Star formation aligns your characters in all four directions around the leader (forward, backward, left and right). This example mapping always aligns them around the character in slot 1.

KeyMap.Name: Control
KeyMap.Description: This Key Map is intended to always be on, which means that all of the hotkeys are in use even if you turn off Key Maps in-game. It contains the toggles for the other Key Maps and Repeater, as well as various mappings used by other features.

MappedKey.Name: Activate Maps
MappedKey.Description:
This toggles Key Maps. It is used by, and updates, the "A,A" icon that shows up by default in the upper left corner in game (a button in the Click Bar called Broadcast).
If you create your own Key Maps (as opposed to adding Mapped Keys to the current Key Maps), you will need to add a Key Map State Action to steps 1 and 2 of this key if you want to toggle your new Key Map. Additionally, if you have different Key Maps per Character Set, you may want to black list any conflicting Key Maps through your Character Set. (Select your Character Set in the top pane, then "Key Maps" in the bottom left pane.)

MappedKey.Name: Activate Mouse Repeat
MappedKey.Description: This toggles Mouse Repeat (1 to 1 broadcasting for the mouse) from the current window to all others. It does not have a Hotkey by default.

MappedKey.Name: Activate Repeat
MappedKey.Description: This toggles both Key and Mouse Repeat (1 to 1 broadcasting for both keyboard and mouse) from the current window to all others.

MappedKey.Name: Click to Move Off
MappedKey.Description: This turns Click to Move off. It is used by the Interact with Target key in the General Key Map.

MappedKey.Name: Click to Move On
MappedKey.Description: This turns Click to Move on. It is used by the Interact with Target key in the General Key Map.

MappedKey.Name: Follow
MappedKey.Description:
This uses the FTL Follow Me key under the General Key Map. It does not have a Hotkey by default.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: Follow/JambaMaster
MappedKey.Description:
This uses the FTL Follow Me key under the General Key Map, and the JambaMaster key under this Key Map. It does not have a Hotkey by default.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: Follow/JambaStrobe
MappedKey.Description:
This uses the FTL Follow Me key under the General Key Map, and the JambaStrobe On key under this Key Map. It does not have a Hotkey by default.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: Follow/JambaStrobe/JambaMaster
MappedKey.Description:
This uses the FTL Follow Me key under the General Key Map, the JambaMaster and the JambaStrobe On key under this Key Map. It does not have a Hotkey by default.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: JambaMaster
MappedKey.Description:
This tells the Jamba Addon to tell the other characters the current one is master.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: JambaStrobe Off
MappedKey.Description: This tells the Jamba Addon to turn off follow strobing. It is used by Toggle Jamba Follow Strobing in the General Key Map.

MappedKey.Name: JambaStrobe On
MappedKey.Description: This tells the Jamba Addon to turn on follow strobing. It is used by Toggle Jamba Follow Strobing in the General Key Map.

MappedKey.Name: Next window
MappedKey.Description: This key can be used to rotate to the next window (in Slot order). Just set a Hotkey above, and Export.

MappedKey.Name: Previous window
MappedKey.Description: This key can be used to rotate to the previous window (in Slot order). Just set a Hotkey above, and Export.

MappedKey.Name: Toggle Broadcast Click Bar
MappedKey.Description: This key can be used to toggle the Broadcast Click Bar

MappedKey.Name: Toggle Formations Click Bar
MappedKey.Description: This key can be used to toggle the Formations Click Bar

KeyMap.Name: FTL DPS Keys
KeyMap.Description:
This is the generated combat oriented Key Map. It was automatically filled with the default Action Bar hotkeys (1 through =). Each of the Mapped Keys will auto-assist and broadcast.
If you need more keys like this, the Many New Mapped Keys option from the right-click menu on Mapped Keys will help you set them up very quickly. See http://isboxer.com/wiki/WoW:Quick_Start_Guide#Quickly_add_many_hotkeys.2C_optionally_with_auto-assist.

MappedKey.Name: DPS 1
MappedKey.Description:
If you press 1 with Key Maps turned on, this Mapped Key will have each of your toons assist you and press 1.
If you need more keys like this, the Many New Mapped Keys option from the right-click menu on Mapped Keys will help you set them up very quickly. See http://isboxer.com/wiki/WoW:Quick_Start_Guide#Quickly_add_many_hotkeys.2C_optionally_with_auto-assist.

MappedKey.Name: Example round-robin
MappedKey.Description: This is a simple example of a round-robin hotkey. It sends "2" to each of 5 windows, one at a time, each time you press the hotkey. To try it out, just set the Hotkey above (to something other than 2, since that is used by DPS 2), and Export.

MappedKey.Name: Example targeted AOE
MappedKey.Description: This is an example of a key that will pass the next mouse click to the other windows, after sending "7". To try it out, just set the Hotkey above (to something other than 7, since that is used by DPS 7), and Export. When you press the Hotkey, mouse broadcasting is temporarily enabled to send the click to the desired windows, until you click!

MappedKey.Name: Melee IWT
MappedKey.Description:
The WoW Quick Start Guide has a section that explains how to set up Interact with Target, which will help you interact with NPCs (e.g. merchants, quest givers and enemies) and, when combined with Click to Move, can be used to keep melees on target.
See http://isboxer.com/wiki/WoW:Quick_Start_Guide#Interaction_with_NPCs.

MappedKey.Description:

This can be used to break auto-follow (WoW does not provide a more convenient method), just set a Hotkey and, if needed, change the key it sends to the other windows in step 1.

WoWMacroSet.Name: Quick Setup 38
WoWMacroSet.Description: This WoW Macro Set contains all of the macros generated by the Quick Setup Wizard from ISBoxer 38

WoWMacro.Name: FTLAssist
WoWMacro.Description: Assists a specific character, depending on the optional modifiers included.

WoWMacro.Name: FTLFollow
WoWMacro.Description: Auto-follows a specific character, depending on the optional modifiers included.

WoWMacro.Name: FTLTarget
WoWMacro.Description: Targets a specific character, depending on the optional modifiers included.

WoWMacro.Name: InviteTeam
WoWMacro.Description: Invites up to 5 Slots in the current Character Set to party

WoWMacro.Name: CTMOn
WoWMacro.Description: Enables Click-to-Move. This is commonly used with Interact with Target to cause a Character to move toward its target.

WoWMacro.Name: JambaMaster
WoWMacro.Description: This will have the Jamba WoW Addon send a message via in-game Addon communications to the other Characters, instructing them to set this Character as its Master.

WoWMacro.Name: JambaStrobeOn
WoWMacro.Description: This will have the Jamba WoW Addon send a message via in-game Addon communications to the other Characters, instructing them to enable its Auto-follow Strobing feature on this Character.

WoWMacro.Name: JambaStrobeOff
WoWMacro.Description: This will have the Jamba WoW Addon send a message via in-game Addon communications to the other Characters, instructing them to disable Auto-follow Strobing.

WoWMacro.MacroCommands:
!if (character is in "Paladins Protection" and character is in "85") /startattack !also /castsequence reset=5 Judgement, Hammer of the Righteous, Shield of the Righteous, Hammer of the Righteous, Crusader Strike !also /cast Avenger's Shield !also /cast Holy Wrath !also /use 13 !also /use 14 !elseif (character is in "Mages Arcane" and character is in "85") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=6 Arcane Blast,Arcane Blast,Arcane Blast,Arcane Barrage !also /cast Presence of Mind !also /cast Mirror Image !also /use Mana Gem !also /cast Arcane Power !also /use 13 !also /use 14 !elseif (character is in "Warlocks Destruction" and character is in "85") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=target/5 Immolate,Fel Flame, Corruption, Incinerate, Incinerate, Incinerate, Life Tap,Incinerate, Incinerate !also /cast Firebolt !also /cast Chaos Bolt !also /use 13 !also /use 14 !elseif (character is in "Rogues Assassination" and character is in "85") /castsequence reset=combat/target mutilate, mutilate, mutilate, mutilate !also /cast Cold Blood !also /cast Vendetta !also /use 13 !also /use 14 !also /use 10
!elseif (character is in "Druids Balance" and character is in "85") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /cast [harm,exists,nodead] Starsurge !also /cast [noform] Moonkin Form
!elseif (character is in "Shamans Elemental" and character is in "85") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=combat/8 Flame Shock,Lightning Bolt,Lightning Bolt,Lightning Bolt,Chain Lightning,Lightning Bolt,Lightning Bolt,Lightning Bolt,Earth Shock,Lightning Bolt,Chain Lightning,Lightning Bolt !also /use 13 !also /cast Elemental Mastery
!elseif (character is in "Paladins Protection" and character is in "70 - 79") /startattack !also /castsequence reset=5 Judgement, Hammer of the Righteous, Shield of the Righteous, Hammer of the Righteous, Crusader Strike !also /cast Avenger's Shield !also /cast Holy Wrath !also /use 13 !also /use 14 !elseif (character is in "Druids Balance" and character is in "70 - 79") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /cast [harm,exists,nodead] Starsurge !also /cast [noform] Moonkin Form !also /use 13 !also /use 14 !elseif (character is in "Shamans Elemental" and character is in "70 - 79") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=combat/8 Call of the Elements,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Searing Totem,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst !also /use 14 !also /cast Thunderstorm
!elseif (character is in "Priests Shadow" and character is in "10 - 19") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=3 Shadow Word: Pain,Mind Flay,Mind Flay,Mind Flay,Mind Flay,Mind Flay,Mind Flay,Mind Flay,Mind Flay !also /use 13 !also /use 14 !elseif (character is in "Shamans Elemental" and character is in "10 - 19") /castsequence reset=combat/8 Searing Totem, Strength of Earth Totem !also /use 13 !also /use 14 !elseif (character is in "Mages Arcane" and character is in "10 - 19") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=6 Fire Blast,Fire Blast,Fire Blast,Arcane Barrage !also /use 13 !also /use 14 !elseif (character is in "Warlocks Destruction" and character is in "10 - 19") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=target/5 Immolate, Corruption, Incinerate, Incinerate, Incinerate, Life Tap,Incinerate, Incinerate !also /cast Shadow Bolt !also /use 13 !also /use 14 !elseif (character is in "Priests Shadow" and character is in "20 - 29") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=3 Shadow Word: Pain,Mind Flay,Mind Flay,Mind Flay,Mind Flay,Mind Flay,Mind Flay,Mind Flay,Mind Flay !also /use 13 !also /use 14 !elseif (character is in "Shamans Elemental" and character is in "20 - 29") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=combat/8 Searing Totem, Strength of Earth Totem !also /use 13 !also /use 14 !elseif (character is in "Mages Arcane" and character is in "20 - 29") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=6 Fire Blast,Fire Blast,Fire Blast,Arcane Barrage !also /use 13 !also /use 14 !elseif (character is in "Warlocks Destruction" and character is in "20 - 29") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=target/5 Immolate, Corruption, Incinerate, Incinerate, Incinerate, Life Tap,Incinerate, Incinerate !also /cast Shadow Bolt !also /use 13 !also /use 14
!elseif (character is in "Priests Shadow" and character is in "30 - 39") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=3 Devouring Plague,Shadow Word: Pain,Mind Flay,Shadow Word: Death,Mind Flay,Mind Flay,Mind Flay,Mind Flay,Devouring Plague,Mind Flay,Mind Flay,Vampiric Touch,Mind Flay,Mind Flay,Shadow Word: Death,Mind Flay !also /use 13 !also /use 14 !elseif (character is in "Mages Arcane" and character is in "30 - 39") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=6 Arcane Blast,Arcane Blast,Arcane Blast,Arcane Barrage !also /cast Presence of Mind !also /use 13 !also /use 14 !elseif (character is in "Warlocks Destruction" and character is in "30 - 39") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=target/5 Immolate, Corruption, Incinerate, Incinerate, Incinerate, Life Tap,Incinerate, Incinerate !also /cast Shadow Bolt !also /use 13 !also /use 14
!elseif (character is in "Paladins Protection" and character is in "60 - 69") /startattack !also /castsequence reset=5 Judgement, Hammer of the Righteous, Shield of the Righteous, Hammer of the Righteous, Crusader Strike !also /cast Avenger's Shield !also /cast Holy Wrath !also /use 13 !also /use 14
!elseif (character is in "Priests Shadow" and character is in "60 - 69") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=3 Vampiric Touch,Devouring Plague,Shadow Word: Pain,Mind Flay,Shadow Word: Death,Mind Flay,Mind Flay,Vampiric Touch,Mind Flay,Mind Flay,Devouring Plague,Mind Flay,Mind Flay,Vampiric Touch,Mind Flay,Mind Flay,Shadow Word: Death,Mind Flay !also /use 13 !also /use 14
!elseif (character is in "Druids Balance" and character is in "60 - 69") /castsequence Starsurge !also /cast [noform] Moonkin Form !also /use 13 !also /use 14 !elseif (character is in "Mages Arcane" and character is in "60 - 69") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=6 Arcane Blast,Arcane Blast,Arcane Blast,Arcane Barrage !also /cast Presence of Mind !also /use 13 !also /use 14
!elseif (character is in "Warlocks Destruction" and character is in "60 - 69") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=target/5 Immolate,Fel Flame, Corruption, Incinerate, Incinerate, Incinerate, Life Tap,Incinerate, Incinerate !also /cast Firebolt !also /cast Chaos Bolt !also /use 13 !also /use 14
!elseif (character is in "Shamans Elemental" and character is in "60 - 69") /castsequence reset=combat/8 Call of the Elements,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Searing Totem,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst !also /use 13 !also /use 14
WoWMacro.Name: SequenceButton

WoWMacro.MacroCommands:
!if (character is in "Paladins Protection" and character is in "85") /castsequence reset=20 Consecration,Divine Protection,Consecration !elseif (character is in "Mages Arcane" and character is in "85") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=6 Arcane Blast,Arcane Missiles !elseif (character is in "Warlocks Destruction" and character is in "85") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=target/10 Soul Fire,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Curse of the Elements,Bane of Doom,Soul Fire,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Soul Fire,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Soul Fire,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Soul Fire,Conflagrate,Bane of Doom,Conflagrate,Soul Fire,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Soul Fire,Conflagrate,Conflagrate !also /cast Demon Soul !elseif (character is in "Rogues Assassination" and character is in "85") /castsequence reset=combat slice and dice, envenom, mutilate, rupture, envenom, envenom, rupture, envenom, envenom, rupture, envenom, envenom, rupture, envenom, envenom !elseif (character is in "Paladins Protection" and character is in "70 - 79") /castsequence reset=20 Consecration,Divine Protection,Consecration !elseif (character is in "Shamans Elemental" and character is in "70 - 79") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=combat/8 Flame Shock,Lightning Bolt,Lightning Bolt,Lightning Bolt,Chain Lightning,Lightning Bolt,Lightning Bolt,Lightning Bolt,Earth Shock,Lightning Bolt,Chain Lightning,Lightning Bolt !also /use 13 !also /cast Elemental Mastery !elseif (character is in "Druids Balance" and character is in "70 - 79") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence Moonfire,Insect Swarm,Wrath,Wrath,Wrath,Wrath,Wrath,Wrath,Wrath,Moonfire,Insect Swarm,Wrath,Wrath,Wrath,Wrath,Wrath,Wrath,Wrath,Moonfire,Insect Swarm,Starfire,Starfire,Starfire,Starfire,Starfire,Moonfire,Insect Swarm,Starfire,Starfire,Starfire,Starfire,Starfire
!elseif (character is in "Shamans Elemental" and character is in "85") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=combat/8 Call of the Elements,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Searing Totem,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst !also /use 14 !also /cast Thunderstorm
!elseif (character is in "Druids Balance" and character is in "85") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence Moonfire,Insect Swarm,Wrath,Wrath,Wrath,Wrath,Wrath,Wrath,Wrath,Moonfire,Insect Swarm,Wrath,Wrath,Wrath,Wrath,Wrath,Wrath,Wrath,Moonfire,Insect Swarm,Starfire,Starfire,Starfire,Starfire,Starfire,Moonfire,Insect Swarm,Starfire,Starfire,Starfire,Starfire,Starfire
!elseif (character is in "Priests Shadow" and character is in "10 - 19") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence Mind Blast,Mind Blast,Mind Blast,Mind Blast,Mind Blast,Mind Blast,Mind Blast,Mind Blast,Mind Blast !elseif (character is in "Shamans Elemental" and character is in "10 - 19") /castsequence reset=combat/8 Lightning Bolt,Lightning Bolt,Lightning Bolt,Lightning Bolt,Lightning Bolt,Lightning Bolt,Earth Shock,Lightning Bolt,Lightning Bolt,Lightning Bolt !elseif (character is in "Mages Arcane" and character is in "10 - 19") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=6 Fireball,Arcane Missiles !elseif (character is in "Warlocks Destruction" and character is in "10 - 19") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=target/10 Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Conflagrate !elseif (character is in "Warlocks Destruction" and character is in "20 - 29") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=target/10 Soul Fire,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Bane of Doom,Soul Fire,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Soul Fire,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Soul Fire,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Soul Fire,Conflagrate,Bane of Doom,Conflagrate,Soul Fire,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Soul Fire,Conflagrate,Conflagrate !elseif (character is in "Mages Arcane" and character is in "20 - 29") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=6 Arcane Blast,Arcane Missiles !elseif (character is in "Priests Shadow" and character is in "20 - 29") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence Mind Blast,Mind Blast,Mind Blast,Mind Blast,Mind Blast,Mind Blast,Mind Blast,Mind Blast,Mind Blast
!elseif (character is in "Priests Shadow" and character is in "30 - 39") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence Mind Blast,Mind Blast,Mind Blast,Mind Blast,Mind Blast,Mind Blast,Mind Blast,Mind Blast,Mind Blast !elseif (character is in "Mages Arcane" and character is in "30 - 39") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=6 Arcane Blast,Arcane Missiles !elseif (character is in "Warlocks Destruction" and character is in "30 - 39") /stopmacro [channeling] !also /castsequence reset=target/10 Soul Fire,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Bane of Doom,Soul Fire,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Soul Fire,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Soul Fire,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Soul Fire,Conflagrate,Bane of Doom,Conflagrate,Soul Fire,Conflagrate,Conflagrate,Soul Fire,Conflagrate,Conflagrate

WoWMacro.Name: ProcButton

WoWMacro.MacroCommands: !if (character is "Disneymax-Shu'halo") /cast [nomounted] !Crusader Aura; [mounted] !Devotion Aura !also /cast [nomounted,noflyable] Summon Charger; [nomounted,flyable] X-53 Touring Rocket !also /dismount [mounted] !elseif (character is "Uncleremus-Shu'halo") /cast [stealth] stealth !also /cast [modifier:ctrl] /dismount; [nomounted,noflyable] Armored Brown Bear; [nomounted,flyable] X-53 Touring Rocket !also /dismount [mounted] !elseif (character is "Jaimelyn-Shu'halo") /cast [stealth] stealth !also /cast [nomounted,noflyable] Great Brewfest Kodo; [nomounted,flyable] Swift Purple Gryphon !also /dismount [mounted] !elseif (character is "Threepwood-Shu'halo") /cast [stealth] stealth !also /cast [nomounted,noflyable] Swift Brewfest Ram; [nomounted,flyable] X-53 Touring Rocket !also /dismount [mounted]

VariableKeystroke.Name: Move Forward
VariableKeystroke.Description: Moves the character forward. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Move Backward
VariableKeystroke.Description: Moves the character backward. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Turn Left
VariableKeystroke.Description: Turns the character counter-clockwise. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Turn Right
VariableKeystroke.Description: Turns the character clockwise. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Move Left
VariableKeystroke.Description: Strafes the character left. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Move Right
VariableKeystroke.Description: Strafes the character right. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Jump
VariableKeystroke.Description: Makes the character jump. (May require HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Follow Target
VariableKeystroke.Description: Most MMORPGs include an Auto-Follow feature, which is useful to move your characters together as a group.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Assist Target
VariableKeystroke.Description: Causes the character to select his target's target, such as to assist in combat against the same enemy. Most games include this feature.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Self
VariableKeystroke.Description: Causes the character to select himself.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 1
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 1, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 2
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 2, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 3
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 3, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 4
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 4, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 5
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 5, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 6
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 6, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Interact with Target
VariableKeystroke.Description: While most MMORPGs require actually clicking with the mouse to perform the default 'right click' action, others including World of Warcraft provide a configurable Hotkey for the same capability.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Focus my Target
VariableKeystroke.Description: Focus is a secondary target available in some games, to remain 'focused' on a target while still being able to click or otherwise select others.

ClickBar.Name: Broadcast
ClickBar.Description:
This defines the icons that you see by default in the upper left corner of the screen in-game. The left icon toggles Key Maps (such as auto-assisting Action Bar hotkeys), and the right icon toggles 1 to 1 broadcasting (Repeater) which is used for example to type the same password in all windows at the same time.
To move this and other Click Bars, bring up the in-game ISBoxer control panel by pressing the hotkey configured in your Character Set (Ctrl+Shift+Alt+G by default from the Quick Setup Wizard). All of ISBoxer's in-game UI will then have draggable title bars.

ClickBar.Name: Formations
ClickBar.Description: This is the default Formations Click Bar. It has icons for activating Flying V, 4-point Star, or Line formations, as defined in the General Key Map.
